page.title: 03MILLBURN GRANGE FARM
page.content: Mr Hunt farms at Millburn Grange.It was bought 70 years ago from the Leighs of Stoneleigh Abbey.It dates from 1561. It is named after a mill over the burn (stream).Mr Hunt farms 234 acres of mixed arable with some stock. There are 150 acres of cereals:barley, wheat and oil seed rape. Mr.Hunt keeps chickens,sheep and stock cattle.He has 300 chickens in a deep liter barn,laying 260 eggs daily. Mr.Hunt's brother-in-law grades and packs the eggs. We tried sizing the eggs. There are 85 cattle including 35 steers. We saw 11 fourteen week old calves in the barn. The cattle usually go to Bausos,in High St.Kenilworth.The farm has 120 ewes and 2 rams.Lambing is in February and March.Stock winters in a large barn
